inputs.name: image
inputs.description: the input image from which statistics will be computed.

inputs.name: output
inputs.description: output only the field specified. Multiple such options can be supplied if required. Choices are: mean, median, std, std_rv, min, max, count. Useful for use in scripts. Both std options refer to the unbiased (sample) standard deviation. For complex data, min, max and std are calculated separately for real and imaginary parts, std_rv is based on the real valued variance (equals sqrt of sum of variances of imaginary and real parts).

type.name: output
type.description: output only the field specified. Multiple such options can be supplied if required. Choices are: mean, median, std, std_rv, min, max, count. Useful for use in scripts. inputs.name: mask
inputs.description: only perform computation within the specified binary mask image.

inputs.name: ignorezero
inputs.description: ignore zero values during statistics calculation

inputs.name: allvolumes
inputs.description: generate statistics across all image volumes, rather than one set of statistics per image volume

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.
